channel.title: Behance Network Featured Projects

item.title: Adapter
item.description: The Adapter is a flexible plug-in that can be used on almost any cylinder object - like your cup, an empty food can or a glass beaker, and turns it into an organized pen holder.
item.content:encoded: The Adapter is a flexible plug-in that can be used on almost any cylinder object - like your cup, an empty food can or a glass beaker, and turns it into an organized pen holder.

item.title: Hiraeth
item.description: Fflur's spectacular final collection has been popularly received. Flowing and feminine in style, it features elaborately hand-cut leather detail, embellishments including Swarovski crystalized ram skulls and handmade high-heeled clogs, all fused in a romantic western theme. This is evidence of creativity and craftsmanship. The honest rustic feel of the collection, no-doubt stemming from a rural upbringing in North Wales.
item.content:encoded: Fflur's spectacular final collection has been popularly received. Flowing and feminine in style, it features elaborately hand-cut leather detail, embellishments including Swarovski crystalized ram skulls and handmade high-heeled clogs, all fused in a romantic western theme. This is evidence of creativity and craftsmanship. The honest rustic feel of the collection, no-doubt stemming from a rural upbringing in North Wales.

item.title: Weston free font
item.description: WESTON is a new rounded slab-serif font designed by Pavel Pavlov for FONTFABRIC. The main purpose is to provide designers with font, suitable for modification in logos and headlines. Combined wisely, Weston will spice up your design adding the not-your-usual-font-choice effect. Inspired by the evergreen Grover & Rockwell, this font would love to find his place in your library. Regular & Light All Caps versions are available for free download @ www.fontfabric.com The whole family will include Light, Regular, Bold, Black and our favorite Inline + small caps.
item.content:encoded: WESTON is a new rounded slab-serif font designed by Pavel Pavlov for FONTFABRIC. The main purpose is to provide designers with font, suitable for modification in logos and headlines. Combined wisely, Weston will spice up your design adding the not-your-usual-font-choice effect. Inspired by the evergreen Grover & Rockwell, this font would love to find his place in your library. Regular & Light All Caps versions are available for free download @ www.fontfabric.com The whole family will include Light, Regular, Bold, Black and our favorite Inline + small caps.

item.title: Morbid Excess
item.description: This project explores the representation of the grotesque as a possible strategy to further develop the Memento Mori tradition. By focusing on depictions of the human anatomy, this project also seeks to examine the relationship between our repulsion to death and decay, and our attraction to beauty and how the distinctions between the both can be blurred. By bringing together discourses relating to surrealism, horror and beauty, the work also aims to question the accepted definitions of aesthetic value. The visual vocabulary from which the work is constructed is borrowed from Victorian-era anatomical etchings. These etchings were taken apart and collaged into symmetrical compositions to create a unique visual effect the style of which was heavily influenced by the filigree detail of the source material. This project also explores the fragmented body as a form of ornament and elaboration, and takes an alternative approach to conventional ornamentation, which often reference aspects of plant life. The main output of this project will consist of a triptych of large pen drawings. The process will also involve experimenting with texture-creating techniques such as stippling and crosshatching.
item.content:encoded: This project explores the representation of the grotesque as a possible strategy to further develop the Memento Mori tradition. By focusing on depictions of the human anatomy, this project also seeks to examine the relationship between our repulsion to death and decay, and our attraction to beauty and how the distinctions between the both can be blurred. By bringing together discourses relating to surrealism, horror and beauty, the work also aims to question the accepted definitions of aesthetic value. The visual vocabulary from which the work is constructed is borrowed from Victorian-era anatomical etchings. These etchings were taken apart and collaged into symmetrical compositions to create a unique visual effect the style of which was heavily influenced by the filigree detail of the source material. This project also explores the fragmented body as a form of ornament and elaboration, and takes an alternative approach to conventional ornamentation, which often reference aspects of plant life. The main output of this project will consist of a triptych of large pen drawings. The process will also involve experimenting with texture-creating techniques such as stippling and crosshatching.

item.title: Oleg Dou
item.description: www.olegdou.com Oleg Dou is a multi award-winning photo artist based in Moscow. He was recipient of the Professional Photographer of the Year in Fine Art award at the International Photography Awards in 2008, 1st place in subcategory for Toystory series. Brief Develop a website to display Oleg Dous portfolio. Solution The idea was to focus solely on his works as the main attraction for visitors and design the site to streamline as smoothly as possible. First, we have hidden the menu (which can be easily accessed by hovering over the top side of the screen with the cursor) to free more space for the photographs. Second, we have arranged a superior smoothness for scrolling, which makes the process of looking through the works highly sensitive and responsive. Finally, a simple click on any photograph enlarges it to let you examine the work in all its minute details. Bonus As a bonus Fl?ve designed a series of icons which can be used as a pattern for Scotch tape, wrapping paper or anything Oleg might have in mind.
item.content:encoded: www.olegdou.com Oleg Dou is a multi award-winning photo artist based in Moscow. He was recipient of the Professional Photographer of the Year in Fine Art award at the International Photography Awards in 2008, 1st place in subcategory for Toystory series. Brief Develop a website to display Oleg Dous portfolio. Solution The idea was to focus solely on his works as the main attraction for visitors and design the site to streamline as smoothly as possible. First, we have hidden the menu (which can be easily accessed by hovering over the top side of the screen with the cursor) to free more space for the photographs. Second, we have arranged a superior smoothness for scrolling, which makes the process of looking through the works highly sensitive and responsive. Finally, a simple click on any photograph enlarges it to let you examine the work in all its minute details. Bonus As a bonus Fl?ve designed a series of icons which can be used as a pattern for Scotch tape, wrapping paper or anything Oleg might have in mind.

item.title: Gordon Millar Award - corporate and web design
item.description: The new Gordon Millar Award honours individuals and organizations that demonstrate philanthropic support of the SAE Foundation (Society of the Automotive Engineers) which promotes science students and young engineers. The design for this award created by moodley is a placard that is not only visual but also tactile representing the way young engineers learn (leather-like paper, sealing wax, foil embossed lettering) The eclectic use of diverse fonts creates a visual whole. Dr. Millar built a bridge from young to old, a bridge to the future by encouraging science students and young engineers , encouraging them to see the magic he saw in the profession he made his lifes work.The design for the Gordon Millar Award is a placard that is not only visual but also tactile to represent the way young engineers learn. Eclectic use of diverse fonts works together to create a visual whole. The finest leather like paper, foil embossed lettering and sealing wax create tactility. Glass is deliberately left off of the framing to allow viewers to also touch the awards tactile surface. CREDITS Client: Society of Automotive Engineers Creative direction: Mike Fuisz Art direction & graphic design: Kurt Glänzer Calligraphy: Elisabeth Küter Product photography: Marion Luttenberger
item.content:encoded: The new Gordon Millar Award honours individuals and organizations that demonstrate philanthropic support of the SAE Foundation (Society of the Automotive Engineers) which promotes science students and young engineers. The design for this award created by moodley is a placard that is not only visual but also tactile representing the way young engineers learn (leather-like paper, sealing wax, foil embossed lettering) The eclectic use of diverse fonts creates a visual whole. Dr. Millar built a bridge from young to old, a bridge to the future by encouraging science students and young engineers , encouraging them to see the magic he saw in the profession he made his lifes work.The design for the Gordon Millar Award is a placard that is not only visual but also tactile to represent the way young engineers learn. Eclectic use of diverse fonts works together to create a visual whole. The finest leather like paper, foil embossed lettering and sealing wax create tactility. Glass is deliberately left off of the framing to allow viewers to also touch the awards tactile surface. CREDITS Client: Society of Automotive Engineers Creative direction: Mike Fuisz Art direction & graphic design: Kurt Glänzer Calligraphy: Elisabeth Küter Product photography: Marion Luttenberger

item.title: ANALOGIC
item.description: ANALOGIC Fashion Editorial for Amusement Magazine First collaboration between Ben Sandler (Photography) and Bonsoir Paris (Installation & Art direction) under the theme "Net Effect". This project relates to the concept of the digital identity, as a philosophical dialogue between the human form and the immaterial representation of our digital selves. Metallic installations serve as metaphors of representations in the digital realm: enveloping and changing our identities, emanating as an material aura. Credits: Photographer BEN SANDLER Artistic Direction / Installation BONSOIR PARIS Photo Assistant ANTOINE TRUFFAUT Post-Production FRANCOIS BROCHENIN @ JANVIER Stylist CLAIRE LE DOUEFF Hair CHRISTIAN ATTULY @ B4 AGENCY Make-up EMILEE BAK Models GOSIA & VALENTIN @ NEW MADISON
item.content:encoded: ANALOGIC Fashion Editorial for Amusement Magazine First collaboration between Ben Sandler (Photography) and Bonsoir Paris (Installation & Art direction) under the theme "Net Effect". This project relates to the concept of the digital identity, as a philosophical dialogue between the human form and the immaterial representation of our digital selves. Metallic installations serve as metaphors of representations in the digital realm: enveloping and changing our identities, emanating as an material aura. Credits: Photographer BEN SANDLER Artistic Direction / Installation BONSOIR PARIS Photo Assistant ANTOINE TRUFFAUT Post-Production FRANCOIS BROCHENIN @ JANVIER Stylist CLAIRE LE DOUEFF Hair CHRISTIAN ATTULY @ B4 AGENCY Make-up EMILEE BAK Models GOSIA & VALENTIN @ NEW MADISON

item.title: Animal Portraits
item.description: The animal portraits is an ongoing project of mine, that will eventually become a coffee table book of some sort. I started out doing these as a weekendproject of 4 images and it took of from there. The theme in the series is the almost human facial expressions of the animals, some look nervous, some arrogant, attentive and so on.
item.content:encoded: The animal portraits is an ongoing project of mine, that will eventually become a coffee table book of some sort. I started out doing these as a weekendproject of 4 images and it took of from there. The theme in the series is the almost human facial expressions of the animals, some look nervous, some arrogant, attentive and so on.
